text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
This section contains the functional statements and responsibilities of the offices within FMSS.
Changes are reﬂected in this IRM include:
a. Updated the Order of Succession at IRM
b. Added the Employee Development Program to the Quality Assurance organization at IRM
c. Added Puerto Rico Territory to Operations Mid-Atlantic at IRM
d. Removed IRM
a) Facilities Support no longer owns the Computer-Aided (CAD) program. The CAD program was moved to Project Management. e. Removed IRM
d and g) Facilities Support no longer oversees the Contracting Officer’s Representative (COR) for Logistics contracts. f. Removed IRM
d) Real Property IRS no longer has delegated authority. g. Editorial changes made throughout the IRM for clarity. Reviewed and updated for plain language and grammar.
Servicewide
Table of Contents
Management and Security Services 1.1.17
) The mission of FMSS is to be a strategic partner with our IRS customers, livering a safe, secure, and optimal work environment that promotes tax administration. (

) To accomplish the mission, FMSS: a. Formulates short and long-range program policies, strategies, and tives for FMSS services to implement the overall IRS support strategy and vision. b. Designs and develops administrative service programs for all internal organizations. c. Directs activities to build partnerships with internal stakeholders. d. Coordinates with other top-level IRS executives to address cross- functional issues, develop strategies, ensure consistency of approach, and meet customer needs. e. Ensures IRS management and employees are provided with and processes to protect lives, property, assets, and information. f. Ensures alignment and compatibility of real estate actions within the strategic plans and FMSS Business Plan. g. Administers the IRS rent budget. h. Formulates, executes, and monitors the FMSS ﬁnancial plan. i. Manages energy utilization and conservation efforts. j. Develops and monitors business measurements that integrate budget performance to balance the level of service with the level of available resources. k. Develops strategies for improving functional service delivery, customer isfaction, and employee satisfaction. l. Ensures best practices are implemented throughout the function. m. Develops and maintains external contacts, including General Services ministration (GSA), National Treasury Employees Union (NTEU), Protective Services (FPS), Department of Homeland Security (DHS), other professional facilities organizations. (

) FMSS supports the IRS by managing resources that enable business processes. FMSS has speciﬁc goals to facilitate the IRS mission. These are: a. Invest in our employees. b. Enhance strategic partnerships. c. Advance data access, usability, and analytics. d. Effectively manage facility operations. (

) The Chief, FMSS reports to the Deputy Commissioner Operations Support (DCOS) and is responsible for providing facilities and physical security for the IRS, through these organizations: a. Facilities Support b. Operations East, Mid-Atlantic, and West c. Project Management d. Quality Assurance e. Security (
) FMSS organizations provide Servicewide program development and for various products and business lines, including: a. Building and Energy Management Internal Revenue Manual

) The Office of the Chief, FMSS of the IRS maintains an updated continuity so that in the absence of the Chief, due to a domestic or foreign enemy on the United States, all hazards, emergencies, or other situations that may disrupt normal operations may be avoided, in accordance with Federal nuity Directives
and
and IRM
, Continuity Planning Requirements, the IRS Business Units; thus, ensuring the continuity of the functions of the office. (
) The management officials who occupy these positions are authorized in of succession to the position of Chief, FMSS:
st successor: Deputy Chief, FMSS
nd successor: Associate Director (AD), Security, FMSS
rd successor: Associate Director (AD), Operations East, FMSS
th successor: Associate Director (AD), Operations West, FMSS (
) This authority may not be redelegated. (
) Source of Authority: Servicewide Delegation Order
, Treasury Order
USC
, and
CFR Part
) The Chief of Staff reports to the Chief, FMSS. (

) The Chief of Staff: a. Conducts streamlining and process improvement studies within FMSS and research opportunities to improve business practices. b. Ensures the FMSS Business Plan aligns with the FMSS and IRS Strategic Plans and ensures its implementation and success. c. Identiﬁes and coordinates FMSS special projects to target the speciﬁc needs of FMSS customers. d. Liaises with IRS internal organizations providing services to FMSS for human resource management and communication needs. e. Develops and oversees reorganizational changes as needed. f. Coordinates, calculates, and initiates Special Act, Manager, Quality Increase, Higher Graded Duties, and Performance Awards for FMSS employees. g. Maintains FMSS organizational chart and ensures adherence to Autho- rized Staffing Plan. h. Formulates FMSS hiring plan and directs hiring/staffing. Internal Revenue Manual Cat. No.
R

Management and Security Services 1.1.17

i. Oversees human resources management functions (i.e., organizational change, performance management, succession planning, training, etc.). j. Coordinates development of signiﬁcant year-end reporting materials. k. Establishes and executes action plans to mitigate risks. (
) The AD, Quality Assurance reports to the Chief, FMSS. (

) Quality Assurance provides policy and operation reviews, analysis, and guidance for the Chief, FMSS and represents FMSS to external in discussions related to internal controls, streamlining, and customer It includes the Program Review and Audit Section. (

) Quality Assurance staff: a. Conducts quality reviews and analyses of FMSS programs to improve effectiveness. b. Identiﬁes program processes and controls that are not operating in dance with policy, procedures, or other requirements and proposes measures to strengthen compliance. c. Provides technical and analytical support to implement program ments and corrective measures. d. Addresses requests and inquiries from the Government Accountability Office (GAO), Treasury Inspector General for Tax Administration the Chief Financial Officer (CFO), and other organizations auditing programs and implements IRS Audit policies. e. Ensures Internal Management Documents (IMD) products (IRM, Policy Statements, Delegation Orders, etc.) are aligned and current and ments IRS IMD policies. f. Gathers and reports FMSS performance measures and implements IRS Business Performance Management System (BPMS) policy. g. Ensures FMSS considers risks to their mission areas and objectives provides subject matter expertise about FMSS to the Enterprise Risk Management (ERM) program to help assess enterprise risks. h. Oversees the Employee Development Program providing training event planning, coordination and reporting. (

) The Deputy Chief, FMSS manages these AD: a. AD, Facilities Support b. AD, Operations East c. AD, Operations Mid-Atlantic d. AD, Operations West e. AD, Project Management f. AD, Security (

) The AD: a. Ensures programs within their control function properly and provide necessary services to meet customer needs. b. Manages FMSS Headquarters (HQ) Program Managers. c. Manages FMSS Territory Managers (TM) responsible for ﬁeld (

) Facilities Support manages key program areas for FMSS that potentially every IRS employee. Facilities Support provides facilities-related guidance support for the entire IRS inventory, including managing operations for mately
million square feet of space at delegated facilities, and FMSS oversight, direction, and technical support for the execution and operation logistics programs. (

) The Facilities Support staff: a. Maintains workplace safety and protects the environment from impact by IRS facilities and operations. b. Manages facility energy usage through awareness, operational and conservation, and fulﬁlls federal reporting requirements. c. Manages the ﬂeet of GSA vehicles for the IRS except for Criminal gation. d. Oversees building management functions at the facilities where IRS delegated authority for operations and maintenance by GSA. e. Manages projects and long-term planning at IRS campus locations major facilities. f. Provides architectural and engineering design, evaluation, and tion support services. g. Oversees Logistics programs. h. Administers the National Mail Services Contract and the National Postage Meter Contract and oversees mail operations at all sites. i. Provides policy, oversight, and strategic planning for the IRS personal property assets. j. Manages the nationwide Telework File Cabinet program. k. Manages the Furniture Reasonable Accommodation (RA) program. l. Coordinates development of signiﬁcant year-end reporting materials. m. Establishes and executes action plans to mitigate risks. (

) The mission of the FMSS Operations is to implement the policies by FMSS HQ organizations through their day-to-day activities and provide services to all IRS employees. (

) Operations consists of HQ and Field functions. The HQ staff includes the program analysts, and staff assistants in Operations East, Mid-Atlantic, and West reporting to the FMSS Deputy Chief. The Field staff includes the TM, their Section Chiefs, and support staff reporting to the Operations AD in HQ. (
) Operations East includes the Andover, Atlanta, Covington, Memphis, and York/New Jersey territories. (
) Operations Mid-Atlantic includes the New Carrollton, Washington DC and Puerto Rico territories. (
) Operations West includes the Austin, Fresno, Kansas City, Oakland, and Ogden territories. (

) The Operations staff: a. Provides review and oversight, plans, organizes, coordinates, and a comprehensive facilities management and security services program that includes space planning and design, building and maintenance agement, security, property management, mail management, and warehousing in conjunction with the FMSS HQ office. b. Collaborates with the Chief and Deputy Chief, FMSS to develop and assign goals for territory managers, reviews and approves multi-year program plans developed by the territories and manages development and implementation of policy changes. c. Manages business improvements, processes, and systems in support their customers. d. Formulates, executes, and monitors facilities management support in conjunction with the Chief, FMSS. e. Collaborates with the GSA and DHS officials as well as other agencies resolve FMSS issues affecting service delivery. f. Coordinates workload demands among assigned ﬁeld FMSS territories ensure equitable service delivery to customers. g. Conducts capacity requirement and workload analysis for ﬁeld FMSS ritories in their areas. h. Ensures services at an acceptable cost to all customer segments and solid business approach for the FMSS operations. i. Ensures timely execution of program activities, determining appropriate program emphasis to achieve goals, managing territory resources,

Organization and ensuring proper application of IRS and United States Government policies and regulations, and maintaining uniform standards. j. ) The TM: a. Serves as principal advisor to executives and operating line ensuring that all FMSS requirements are fully met and integrated into overall management of the organizations served. b. Establishes FMSS program objectives, ensures timely execution of program activities, determines appropriate program emphasis to goals, manages territory resources, and ensures proper application of IRS and USG policies and regulations. c. Prepares short and long-range work plans, budgets, goals, and objec- tives. d. Serves as a local point of contact for all Business Units serviced by territory. e. Supervises and is responsible for the activities of sections dedicated delivering assigned programs to customers. f. Oversees the protection of IRS employees, visitors, facilities, critical business operations, and assets. g. Coordinates development of signiﬁcant year-end reporting materials. h. Establishes and executes action plans to mitigate risks. (
) Project Management: a. Provides FMSS oversight, direction, and technical support for the execution and operation of real estate projects and programs. (

) The Project Management staff: a. Establishes and communicates procedures for IRS real estate project delivery. b. Evaluates and processes Business Unit requirements for all real projects. c. Manages and coordinates the Project Investment Fund and ﬁnal head- quarters approval of project funding. d. Owns the Space, Time and Resources (STAR) automated tool to FMSS and develops guidelines to support the STAR functionality. e. Coordinates IT funding of Space and Housing projects. f. Improves program effectiveness through data analysis and research. g. Coordinates development of signiﬁcant year-end reporting materials. h. Establishes and executes action plans to mitigate risks. i. Provides ﬁnancial guidance and resource management including formulation, development, and execution. j. Serves as FMSS liaison with the CFO. k. Formulates, submits, and presents the out-year project budget require- ments to the CFO Program & Budget Advisory Committee and the IT Development/Modernization/Enhancement. l. Oversees the Computer-Aided Design (CAD) program for facility ﬂoor plans and linking CAD drawings to Graphic Database (GDI)

) Rent: a. Reconciles the GSA rent bills, forecasts rent expenses for the current and future years, and tracks the inventory of IRS space holdings. b. Certiﬁes GSA rent Intragovernmental Payment and Collection System (IPCS). (

) The Rent staff: a. Reviews Occupancy Agreements and updates rates, square footage, building information in GDI accordingly. b. Issues a Monthly Acquisition and Release control to the Territories to ascertain the status of projects that result in acquisition or release of space. c. Validates rent charges and pursues corrections for billing errors with GSA. d. Tracks inventory of buildings and square footage in inventory. e. Analyzes the GSA Rent Estimate and compares the GSA estimate to IRS estimate and makes the necessary updates in GDI. f. Prepares the Exhibit

, Space Budget Justiﬁcation that accompanies Treasury budget request to Office of Management and Budget. g. Partners with Portfolio Management and CAFM to ensure all building data is accurate. h. Provides reports and guidance to various Business Units. i. Prepares and processes funding documents for the rent budget. (

) Real Property: a. Provides oversight for managing the real property assets at the IRS. b. Develops policy and implements guidance, procedures, objectives, practices, and standards for the administration, management, and oversight of the IRS real property and space management programs. c. Develops and administers long-term space and housing strategy for campus and non-campus locations, including oversight and tracking of space reduction projects. d. Provides real property and space management Subject Matter Expert (SME) training and technical support to FMSS staff. e. Ensures that IRS real estate management practices are consistent presidential directives, executive orders, federal laws, regulations, and policies.

f. Represents IRS with Treasury, GSA, contractors, industry trade and fessional organizations, and other stakeholders regarding the management of real estate and other cross-functional issues. g. Collaborates and communicates with internal FMSS program areas to identify gaps that impact their service to the IRS. h. Partners and coordinates with external service providers to develop effective solutions to help FMSS carry out its mission. i. Ensures FMSS meets its strategic goals and objectives by analyzing external mandates and inﬂuences. j. Provides primary customer support for Business Operating Division(s) (BOD) planning and hiring initiatives that require FMSS services. k. Assists in the resolution of issues, problems, and concerns and cates directly with BOD customer representatives. l. Participates in BOD organizational development planning on long-range issues, such as space plans, funding issues, and customer m. Reviews FMSS strategic initiatives and recommend solutions that both support FMSS policies and procedures and BOD requirements. n. Serves as primary point of contact on corporate level projects. o. Serves as a communication conduit between each BOD and FMSS. p. Manages the Space Advisory Group (SAG) to broker challenges and solutions facing multiple BOD. (

) FMSS HQ Security develops and communicates security policies and dures to provide a comprehensive, Servicewide program to protect IRS employees, visitors, facilities, critical business operations, and assets. Key policies and procedures are developed to: a. Support and execute the Homeland Security Presidential Directive (HSPD)-
Smart Identiﬁcation and Pocket Commission Credentials programs. b. Implement HSPD-
with servicewide AIM office in compliance with M-
, Federal Information Processing Standards (FIPS)
, National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST)
, Rev.

standards for physical access control. c. Adhere to the Interagency Security Committee (ISC) Risk Process. d. Validate the IRS compliance with the Classiﬁed National Security mation (CNSI) program and National Industrial Security Program (

) The Security staff establishes policies and procedures for: a. Providing an appropriate level of physical security through application ISC standards, to include guidelines for the use of guards, canine services, and security countermeasures at IRS facilities. b. Providing physical access control to admit authorized personnel and prevent entry by unauthorized persons. c. Controlling, issuing, and disposing of ID media to identify the bearer representative of the IRS. Internal Revenue Manual

functional issues. Collaborates and communicates with internal FMSS program areas to identify gaps that impact their service to the IRS. Partners and coordinates with external service providers to develop effective solutions to help FMSS carry out its mission. Ensures FMSS meets its strategic goals and objectives by analyzing external mandates and inﬂuences. Provides primary customer support for Business Operating Division(s) (BOD) planning and hiring initiatives that require FMSS services. Assists in the resolution of issues, problems, and concerns and cates directly with BOD customer representatives. Participates in BOD organizational development planning on long
range issues, such as space plans, funding issues, and customer Reviews FMSS strategic initiatives and recommend solutions that both support FMSS policies and procedures and BOD requirements.

Smart Identiﬁcation and Pocket Commission Credentials programs. b. Implement HSPD-

, Federal Information Processing Standards (FIPS)

standards for physical access control. c. Adhere to the Interagency Security Committee (ISC) Risk Management Process. d. Validate the IRS compliance with the Classiﬁed National Security Infor- mation (CNSI) program and National Industrial Security Program The Security staff establishes policies and procedures for: a. Providing an appropriate level of physical security through application ISC standards, to include guidelines for the use of guards, canine services, and security countermeasures at IRS facilities. b. Providing physical access control to admit authorized personnel and prevent entry by unauthorized persons. c. Controlling, issuing, and disposing of ID media to identify the bearer as representative of the IRS.

Providing an appropriate level of physical security through application of ISC standards, to include guidelines for the use of guards, canine services, and security countermeasures at IRS facilities. Providing physical access control to admit authorized personnel and prevent entry by unauthorized persons. Controlling, issuing, and disposing of ID media to identify the bearer as a representative of the IRS.

d. Providing guidelines to IRS employees, contractors, and visitors for response to an emergency at an IRS occupied facility. e. Reporting and notifying appropriate personnel of physical security incidents in and around facilities occupied by IRS personnel. f. Supporting stakeholder organizations to mitigate security risks associated with contractor access by identifying, assessing, and prioritizing the physical security risk to IRS facilities. g. Managing, handling, and protecting CNSI by IRS employees and tors. h. Analyzing, coordinating, and monitoring training to enhance the profes- sional development of physical security specialists. (
